steps.description: Remove the mixture from the saucepan and cool it just to where you can hold it in your hands. You don't want it to cool completely, otherwise molding it will be extremely difficult because it will be pretty hard.

steps.headline: Mold into rectangular shapes.

steps.headline: Insert craft sticks into the treats.

Making the Rice Krispies Mixture Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Over a low heat setting, melt the butter to where it is nearly all liquid. Add the marshmallows. Combine and stir the butter and marshmallows until everything is melted thoroughly. Remove the pan from the heat. Add and fold in the cereal. As you stir, it may become a challenge to get the cereal coated. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ae\/Make-Rice-Krispies-Paint-Brush-Treats-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Rice-Krispies-Paint-Brush-Treats-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ae\/Make-Rice-Krispies-Paint-Brush-Treats-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Rice-Krispies-Paint-Brush-Treats-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Molding the Rice Krispies Allow the mixture to cool. Remove the mixture from the saucepan and cool it just to where you can hold it in your hands. You don't want it to cool completely, otherwise molding it will be extremely difficult because it will be pretty hard. Mold into rectangular shapes. Grease your hands with either butter or shortening prior to molding, as this will make it easier to shape the mixture. The size of the brushes are up to you. Just remember that you will need more Rice Krispies for longer brushes, and thus, you will end up with a lesser total amount. Insert craft sticks into the treats. Before the treats completely cools down, push wooden craft sticks or ice cream scoop sticks about 1/3 to 1/2 in the bottom of the Rice Krispies. Lay the treats on wax paper. To avoid any sticking while the treats are cooling down, lay them on wax or parchment paper. Dipping the Paint Brushes Melt the chocolate. You can either use a microwave-safe bowl or create a double boiler. Stir the chocolate to make sure everything is melted evenly. Dip the treats in the chocolate. Using the wooden sticks as handles, dip about 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) of the top of the treats into the chocolate. Lay the treats back onto the wax paper. Fully allow the chocolate to harden before consuming or packaging. Finished.
